org.openntf.domino
Interface ACL

All Superinterfaces:
ACL, Base, DatabaseDescendant, java.lang.Iterable<ACLEntry>, Resurrectable, SessionDescendant
public interface ACL
extends Base<lotus.domino.ACL>, ACL, java.lang.Iterable<ACLEntry>, Resurrectable, DatabaseDescendant

The Interface that represents the access control list (ACL) of an IBM Domino database.

Method Detail

addRole

void addRole(java.lang.String name)
Adds a role with the specified name to an ACL.

Parameters:
name - The name of the role to add
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

createACLEntry

@Deprecated
ACLEntry createACLEntry(java.lang.String name,
                                   int level)
Deprecated. in favour of org.openntf.domino.ext.ACL#createACLEntry(String, Level)

Creates an entry in the ACL with the name and level that you specify.

Parameters:
name - The name of the person, group, or server for whom you want to create an entry in the ACL. You must supply the complete name, but hierarchical names can be in abbreviated format. Case is not significant.
level - The level that you want to assign to this person, group, or server in the ACL. May be any of the following :

  • ACL.LEVEL_NOACCESS (0)
  • ACL.LEVEL_DEPOSITOR (1)
  • ACL.LEVEL_READER (2)
  • ACL.LEVEL_AUTHOR (3)
  • ACL.LEVEL_EDITOR (4)
  • ACL.LEVEL_DESIGNER (5)
  • ACL.LEVEL_MANAGER (6)
Returns:
The newly-created ACLEntry.
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

deleteRole

void deleteRole(java.lang.String name)
Deletes a role with the specified name from an ACL.

Parameters:
name - The name of the role to delete
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

getAdministrationServer

java.lang.String getAdministrationServer()
Returns the name of the administration server for an IBM Domino database.

The administration server is also the master lock server.
This property is an empty string if the database does not have an administration server.

Returns:
the administration server
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

getEntry

ACLEntry getEntry(java.lang.String name)
Given a name, finds its entry in an ACL.

Parameters:
name - The name whose ACL Entry you want to find. You must supply the complete name, but hierarchical names can be in abbreviated format. Case is not significant.
Returns:
The ACLEntry that matches the name. If name is not in the ACL, returns null.
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

getFirstEntry

ACLEntry getFirstEntry()
Returns the first entry in an ACL.

The first entry is typically the -Default- entry.

Returns:
The first ACLEntry in the ACL.
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

getInternetLevel

int getInternetLevel()
The maximum Internet access level for this database.

  • ACL.LEVEL_NOACCESS (0)
  • ACL.LEVEL_DEPOSITOR (1)
  • ACL.LEVEL_READER (2)
  • ACL.LEVEL_AUTHOR (3)
  • ACL.LEVEL_EDITOR (4)
  • ACL.LEVEL_DESIGNER (5)
  • ACL.LEVEL_MANAGER (6)

Returns:
The current maximum internet access level of the database. May be any of the following :
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

getNextEntry

ACLEntry getNextEntry()
Returns the ACL Entry following the last ACL Entry retrieved.

The no-parameter method improves performance for remote operations because ACL entries are cached locally.

The order of the ACL entries is unspecified. The order is not alphabetical and does not correspond to UI displays.

Returns:
The next ACLEntry in the ACL. Returns null if there are no more entries.
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

getNextEntry

ACLEntry getNextEntry(lotus.domino.ACLEntry entry)
Returns the ACL entry following the entry specified as the parameter.

The order of the ACL entries is unspecified. The order is not alphabetical and does not correspond to UI displays.

Parameters:
entry - Any entry in the ACL. Cannot be null.
Returns:
The the ACLEntry following the entry specified as the parameter. Returns null if there are no more entries.
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

getParent

Database getParent()
Returns the IBM Domino database that owns the ACL.

Returns:
The Database that this ACL belongs to.
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

getRoles

java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> getRoles()
Returns all the roles defined in an access control list.

Each element in the vector is the name of a role. Each role name is surrounded by square brackets, for example, "[Supervisor]."

Notes Release 2 "privileges" are surrounded by parentheses. Properties and methods affecting roles, such as disableRole and enableRole, do not work on privileges.

Returns:
A Vector of all the roles in the ACL. Elements are of type String
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

isAdminNames

boolean isAdminNames()
Indicates whether the administration server for the database can modify all Names fields in a database.

The database must have an administration server. See getAdministrationServer() in ACL and ACLEntry.isAdminServer() in

Returns:
Returns true if the administration server can modify all names fields, false if it cannot. ACLEntry to check for the administration server.
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

isAdminReaderAuthor

boolean isAdminReaderAuthor()
Indicates whether the administration server for the database can modify Readers and Authors fields in a database.

The database must have an administration server. See getAdministrationServer() in ACL and ACLEntry.isAdminServer() in

Returns:
Returns true if the administration server can modify Readers and Authors fields, false if it cannot. ACLEntry to check for the administration server.
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

isExtendedAccess

boolean isExtendedAccess()
Indicates whether extended access is enabled.

In the Notes UI, this property is in the advanced section of ACL properties: "Enable Extended Access." and only applies to Domino Directory, Extended Directory Catalog, and Administration Requests databases.

Returns:
Returns true if extended access is enabled, false if it is not enabled.
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

isUniformAccess

boolean isUniformAccess()
Indicates whether a consistent access control list is enforced across all replicas of a database.

Returns:
Returns true if uniform access is enabled, false if it is not enabled.
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

removeACLEntry

void removeACLEntry(java.lang.String name)
Removes an entry from the ACL.

After calling this method, you must call save() for the changes to take effect. If you do not call save, your changes to the ACL are lost.

Parameters:
name - The name of the person, group, or server whose entry you want to remove. You must supply the complete name, but hierarchical names can be in abbreviated format. Case is not significant.
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

renameRole

void renameRole(java.lang.String oldName,
                java.lang.String newName)
Changes the name of a role.

After calling this method, you must call save() for the changes to take effect. If you do not call save, your changes to the ACL are lost.

When you rename a role, any entries in the ACL that had the old role get the new role.

Parameters:
oldName - The current name of the role. Do not put square brackets around the name.
newName - The current name of the role. Do not put square brackets around the name.
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

save

void save()
Saves changes that you've made to the ACL.

If you don't call save before closing a database, the changes you've made to its ACL are lost.

Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

setAdministrationServer

void setAdministrationServer(java.lang.String server)
Sets the name of the administration server for a database.

The administration server is also the master lock server.
This property is an empty string if the database does not have an administration server.

Parameters:
server - the name of the server you want to set as the Administration Server.
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

setAdminNames

void setAdminNames(boolean flag)
Sets whether the administration server for the database can modify all Names fields in a database.

The database must have an administration server. See getAdministrationServer() in ACL and

Parameters:
flag - The boolean value to set ACLEntry.isAdminServer() in ACLEntry to set the administration server.

After setting this property, you must call save() for the changes to take effect. If you do not call save, your changes to the ACL are lost.

Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

setAdminReaderAuthor

void setAdminReaderAuthor(boolean flag)
Sets whether the administration server for the database can modify Readers and Authors fields in a database.

The database must have an administration server. See getAdministrationServer() in ACL and

Parameters:
flag - The boolean value to set ACLEntry.isAdminServer() in ACLEntry to set the administration server.

After setting this property, you must call save() for the changes to take effect. If you do not call save, your changes to the ACL are lost.

Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

setExtendedAccess

void setExtendedAccess(boolean flag)
Sets whether extended access is enabled.

In the Notes UI, this property is in the advanced section of ACL properties: "Enable Extended Access." and only applies to Domino Directory, Extended Directory Catalog, and Administration Requests databases.

Setting this property true automatically sets setUniformAccess(boolean) true. Setting this property false does not automatically set setUniformAccess(boolean) false.

After setting this property, you must call save() for the changes to take effect. If you do not call save, your changes to the ACL are lost.

Parameters:
flag - The boolean value to set
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

setInternetLevel

void setInternetLevel(int level)
Sets the maximum Internet access level for this database.

Parameters:
level - The new maximum Internet level you want to set in the ACL. May be any of the following :

  • ACL.LEVEL_NOACCESS (0)
  • ACL.LEVEL_DEPOSITOR (1)
  • ACL.LEVEL_READER (2)
  • ACL.LEVEL_AUTHOR (3)
  • ACL.LEVEL_EDITOR (4)
  • ACL.LEVEL_DESIGNER (5)
  • ACL.LEVEL_MANAGER (6)
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0

setUniformAccess

void setUniformAccess(boolean flag)
Sets whether a consistent access control list is enforced across all replicas of a database.

After setting this property, you must call save() for the changes to take effect. If you do not call save, your changes to the ACL are lost.

Parameters:
flag - The boolean value to set
Since:
lotus.domino 4.5.0
